content:
Thunderbird threads conversations by default. Many people don‚Äôt want threaded conversation. There are several things one can do to prevent and change threaded conversations.

First, go to Settings - General - Config Editor. Search for mailnews.default_view_flags and change the setting to 0. This setting should change the default view.

If threaded conversations do appear, there are at least two ways to change them to unthreaded.

1) View - Sort by - Unthreaded affects the current message list.

2) Copy your preferred message list settings from one list to another. At the far right of the column headers in every message list, there is a button to ‚ÄúSelect columns to display‚Äù. Click on it. At the bottom of the list that appears, there is a command to ‚ÄúApply current view to ‚Ä¶‚Äù If you have folders with ‚Äúchildren‚Äù folders, you can apply your preference of no threads to the parent and the children in one step.

Official documentation on threading is here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

SORTING

Once you have your columns set as you want them, you can use the next-to-last option in ‚ÄúSelect columns to display‚Äù to copy your settings to other message list windows.

To set the default sort column and sort order, use the configuration editor (Settings - General - Config Editor ‚Ä¶‚Äù.) To get the sort order typical of e-mail apps, descending by date, set mailnews.default_sort_type to 18 (date) and mailnews.default_sort_order to 2.

More information about sorting options is here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/143239

Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo

  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate

content:
If you use Windows, these steps should work: Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

If not windows, let me know. The zip option is not as reliable (in my opinion) as using windows file explorer to do the copy.

content: Sometimes there are interruptions to thunderbird from other sources, such as antivirus. Your profile may still be there with all content. You can see that by these steps: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - you are now in profile, in windows file explorer, click back one folder so that you are in the 'profiles' folder Is there more than one profile showing? If so, browse the content of both. Yours will have account info in either the imapmail folder or the mail folder. If you confirm the right profile, your next steps are these: - in thunderbird, click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' - click the 'create profile' button - click 'next' - enter a short nickname, such as LOSTPROFILE and then click the 'choose' button to locate and select the profile you discovered, then click finish and launch.
creator: davidsk
